review: I have a love-hate relationship with this place. I'm seldom in the mood to go here, but when I do it's usually good.  Went last week and had a red sangria, the roasted corn guacamole with salsa and chips, and crispy shrimp tacos with rice and black beans. All was delicious. The roasted corn guacamole could have been larger (because it was so scrumptious). The crispy shrimp tacos looked slim BUT tasted great. With the sangria to wash it all down I left full and satisfied. I just don't know why :-/ Wait staff was friendly, but not confident. I like a waiter/waitress with a strong opinion. But all in all, it was a nice experience. I sound so wishy-washy, I know. But that's what Chilis does to me. So, go there??? I guess. I'll be back again someday.

Went here for Cinco De Mayo and had the El Presidente Margarita with the Nachos Grande and the Fajita Trio. I wasn't impressed with the food at all. However, my server, F, was very friendly and accommodating even though he was extremely busy. The Margarita is usually good, but it was TOO salty here. The Nachos were the best part of the meal (I usually get guacamole with mine).  The Fajito Trio wasn't good at al and I didn't eat it. There were way too many onions which seemed like they were drenched in oil. The shrimp wasn't well done and the chicken tasted WAY too processed.

I went to this Chili's location regularly until a few months ago. My last experience was so bad that I will never return.  We were completely ignored by the waitstaff for at least 15 minutes after we were seated. The kitchen area was in view from where I was sitting, and I could see servers on their cell phones, fixing their makeup, etc.  Once we were finally able to place an order, our chips took another 25 minutes to come out. After having sat for 40 minutes before getting an appetizer, we were starving, so we dug in. To my horror, I realized that there was a deep- fried roach on the bottom of the chips basket. When I showed to roach to the manager, he didn't seem surprised. His exact words were, "Oh, yeah. That's a roach." We walked out before the rest of the food came out. That's the only time I've had to do that. Chili's corporate was very nice when I contacted them, and I was sent something for my troubles. I will go to Chili's again, just not this location!

I frequent this Chili's because it's in a great spot and the wait is usually not long. The place is very clean, and you are seated quickly. I ordered from the 2 for 20.00 menu, the food came out at a reasonable pace. The waitstaff is not the quickest, but they are not the slowest either. I have always had attentive, friendly waiters, and they are pretty consistent on their food. Usually, when I go to other Chilis in the area I am given chips, but this one does not give them to you unless you order them. Overall, the food is good, comes out fast and hot, the waiters that I have dealt with were always personable and helpful. They added some extras to their 2 for 20 menu like cheddar bacon smother steak, and a loaded one. Try this place out, just avoid it when the Jets or Giants are playing in town because a lot of fans eat there before the game and it can get packed!

My actual rating for this place would be a negative 10. Service was slow and the place itself was so disgustingly dirty. Napkins and food was all over the floor. My cutlery was dirty as well. The worst thing about this place was that there was 1 piece of buffalo wing from our order that was BLOODY inside. It was brought to the manager's attention and all he did was take the appetizer off our bill. My family and I are definitely not EVER coming back to this place.

My husband and I ordered Chilis to Go from here twice within the past month or so as we have quite a bit of $ in gift cards. Last time, I ordered the steak from the "healthy options" menu.  Although I requested it Medium - it was most definitely RARE - and as I didn't cut into it until I got it home, it was too late to do anything. Most recently, we ordered chips and salsa with our meals, and they forgot to pack the salsa.  Again, we were home already, and I wasn't about to go back just for salsa.  Not a huge deal (the rest of the food was good), but still an inconvenience. May switch to the next closest Chili's location as we haven't had issues there.

I've been here a couple times in the past couple months and I would say this place is okay if you have a couple of hours to spare and like mediocre food.  I feel like you usually have to wait for a table and the service is pretty slow once you do get a table. Most of the waiters/waitresses look  young and are very inexperienced.  The food itself is okay, but it's nothing to write home about.  Our main reason for coming here is probably because of the molten cake which is probably the best thing on the menu.  The coffee also tastes pretty bad and never seems to be hot when served.

Food was good but service is horrible. We waited about 10-15 minutes to be seated and the place was EMPTY. Chili's employees were nowhere to be found. Actually, on my way to the restroom I've found two -sitting and hanging out in a booth. They were there for half an hour or more. Our waitress confessed it was her 2nd day on the job, which is fine of course, but do your job. She promised everything and forgot it all. Like handing out the menus once we were seated, plates, drinks, no special stuff just what we need for/with our meal. She asked a couple of times if all was okay but after I said yes, she ran away, kind of. If I asked her a question I could never ask another one because again, she ran away. Weird! Then she disappeared in the back and took a long time to come out. She was attending 3 booths on her own so it wasn't a lot to cater to (and all 3 happened to be one next to the other). I'll probably try to come here on the weekend or mind that is not after a holiday...
Food is good. Service is usually good. Avoid the waitress named Paulette. She's an awful server and extremely inattentive.
The service here is very subpar. The food definitely makes up for the lack of service. I'd definitely recommend the cheddar bacon quesadillas. Their amazing.

This location is awful.  The hostess was slow to seat us and the waitress was even worse.  We waited almost 45 minutes for appetizers which only came after complaining to the waitress who blamed the food runners and bitched about having to get the food herself.  Then they had the nerve to bring our dinners out right on top of the appetizers.  Not Happy at all.....

I love their new sparkling pomegranate margaritas. Served in a short tumbler glass, these make the perfect accompaniment to any dish, but for me I chose to go straight with a Latin style and chose the Chile Tilapia.  While the server promised me it wouldn't be too spicy, well the glaze was Habanero so I wasn't expecting mild. Definitely cleared the sinuses. Service was good, a little slow, but we were relaxed on a Saturday afternoon. My mom got the three pick sampler, was disjointed that the sliders were only two in the basket, but loved the rest.  The flatbreads are a good alternative, light and crispy with enough to share. No complaints.

I feel like this place changed.  I used to come a lot but the service is really slow.  Everything was dirty that i wanted to wash everything myself.  I asked for a well done but my food looked as if it was rare.  Not to say that it took the waitress 40 minutes to get our checks (the place was not busy at all)
very quick service,the food was great,very clean place and the pina colada was very good.I definitely will go back.

I am not sure why it would not deserve 4 star. Let's start with drinks and they were great. Now appetizer we got spinach dip and chips . Chips could be little well done would be great but it was okay. Main course was chipotle chicken flat bread piZza huge portion and great taste. Could not finish all so got it to go. In dessert I got molten chocolate which was really good. Service was attentive and good. Overall yes I will go back. Yeah but with friends. As by myself I think I ordered a lot !!! But was cheap $30 + tips ... Over all great experience

Service terrible. I ordered a salad online at 9, to be ready by 910. When I showed up to pick it up at 915, they hadnt reviwed the order. No explanation from the hostess after she passed me several times. Waited until 10 for my meal. Never again.

1/2 star because the appetizer was good other then that it was bad.  We only had to wait about 10 minutes.  Not to bad.  We ordered the triple dipper which was good.  I ordered the California Chicken Flat bread. The chicken did not taste like chicken and there was no flavoring. My friend ordered the combination fajita (shrimp,beef and chicken).  The food did not look appetizing.  I will not be back.

Came back to this Chili's again and gave it one more chance it took almost about 10 minutes I got the chips tasted pretty good ordered Five Cheese Pizza tasted pretty good I was to full from the pizza so we decided not to stay for desert overall Better than last time I will come back

I have been going here recently and I like it better than the one on rt 46. I do want to mention that the service could be better but the food is pretty good. Like I said better than the one on rt 46 but not perfect.  The staff is friendly though and they try to be helpful but they miss the little things like napkins and ranch and water that I asked for 10 mins ago among other things.

Stay Away.  Our experience here was so bad it was almost laughable.  We looked for hidden camera's because it was just that bizarre.  The hostess seated us.  Our waiter came up a few minutes later and introduced himself and told us if we needed anything and he wasn't around we could ask the hostess (weird). Then there was the computer thing that we still don't know what we were supposed to do with it... they never explained it and we are not from an area that has this technology.  The waiter was friendly enough.  He upgraded us from fries to some mac and cheese side dish.  He then offered to bring the kids food out ahead of time so it could cool... okay we thought... good suggestion.  So we thought it odd when our food came before the kids.  He brought it out and said "I told them to put the kids in first" then shrugged it off and walked away.  My husband bit into the mac and cheese... ICE COLD.  We called the waiter over and told him.  He offered to get us a new one.  Then comes back with the same dish, steaming hot and liquid about 30 seconds later.  When asked if it was microwaved, he shrugged and said "yeah.. that's what we do", then took the bowl away and brought back french fries (weird), with no further conversation.  My husband bit into his chicken sandwich and I knew we had another issue. The bread was rock hard stale. He pulled the top layer off and it was flaking in chunks inside.  Pretty bad.  We called the waiter over.  He didn't look surprised, just offered to get my husband another dish.  When my husband refused to try to eat anything else, the waiter said "I'll just go get the manager for you" and turned around and left.  After 20 minutes, he came back saying the manager was not available and that he will just take the food off the bill, brought us the bill and never came back.  What kind of manager doesn't come out to talk to dissatisfied guests? We left, my husband still hungry and will never be back.  This place left such a sour taste in our mouth.

Well. what a disappointment. this has to be the worst chilis in my area. first off the chicken bacon ranch quesadillas were rubbery. like if flubber was hiding in that quesadilla. the french fries were freezing. the coke was brown seltzer water and im pretty sure my server was stoned. but thats besides the point after complaining to management we got a paradise pie. more like a paradise brick. i literally broke the spoon trying to get ONE little piece. this place is horrible. the music is loud and the staff looks like the cast of 90210. just bunch of kids hanging out havin fun. This chilis is gross and ruins the chilis franchise for me.

I wanted to write this review AT Chili's but unfortunately I must write this in the privacy of my home....from my bathroom. I don't think I'll ever pass by this side of route 17 again without the violent stomach ache I suffer when I'm here. I order the cheesy fries which should be a pancake since you can't pull a fry individually from it. I love how everything here is seasoned with the same season salt. The fries. The burgers. The ice cream. The soda. The napkins. Everything has that same freakin seasoning. And idk what the hell is in the food that gives me ulcers when I snack here. I try to like this place I do...but I can't. Did I mention how dark it is? I feel like I'm at Hollister when I eat here. And god knows you cant see what you're buying in Hollister. Well Chili's is no different. I ran out of battery trying to use it as a flashlight to see my menu...while charging it and it died. And the best part? I didn't know this was a Chinese buffet. Barely got my food and the waitress had the bill on the table. "No rush." Wth you mean no rush?! I should've taken it as a sign from god to not eat there. Never again. Unless you need motivation to use a bathroom come here. No, go to white castle. It hurts less.

This was the fastest Chilis in history. Maybe too fast.  My frozen margarita came within minutes but my dining partners was delivered five minutes later. Not sure why they were not delivered together. The food came out quick It was good. We ordered fajitias but the onions were over cooked (inedible).  Overall, I would give the food 4/5. Service 4/5. The Chilis was clean and I would come back again.
Your typical chilis. Comfortable atmosphere and only edible food. Only visit here if friends want to go.

Very clean, comfortable atmosphere.   Our waiter,  Steve was Great. Food was good and the drinks are fabulous.   Management (forgot his name) was very nice....all around nice vibe,  upbeat and young.....love it....we will be back.....good job Steve...

I came to the chili's on route 17 with my boyfriend.  We ordered fajitas, and their quality was way down from what it was years ago.  We got all onions as a cheap filler, no flavor at all. No lime. Nothing. My boyfriend only got three pieces of meat that were way overdone and very unappealing. We'll never eat there again. Go back to the old menu. It was like the people in the kitchen were all kids, or just didn't care.

I was there in January 2015 me and my husband are regulars there. We both got extremely bad food poisoning off your ranch quesadillas. My stomach hasn't been the same since. I called and complained to your manager I believe is name was mike not sure. I was very nice about it due to the fact I am a manager in a restrauant. He took my information down and sent me 30.00 in coupons I was insulted due to the fact me and my husband were so sick from your food. We have still not returned to your location which is sad cause we dined there twice a week I am just to scared to eat there again.
The food is great they have a pretty good selection .  But there management is horrible there manager needs more training

Overall as a chain it was pretty average when it came to food. The food tasted like it should, but i felt that the customer service here was lacking a good amount. Two of us walked in on a tuesday night around 7pm and it was fairly empty. The hostess came up to us and said "let me check to see if there's a table for you"..... Then a few minutes later (mind you, only 30% of the tables were in use) she comes back and says she found one. I know that doesn't sound like a lot of time but when you're looking at a fully empty restaurant it boils your blood. Then it took about 10 minutes for the server to ask if we wanted something to drink.  And to top this all off, my biggest pet peeve of all time. The appitizers and food came out at the same time. I really not normally a pain in the butt, but this just bothered me.

I tell you for a chain they have some pretty decent good food! Went with the family and order (2) 2 for $20's. I had the chicken and pork fajitas which came with a nice amount of meat as well as onions and peppers. All the fixings came on the side and overall exactly what i wanted in my belly. Had a issue with my mothers meal which was cold and too spicy for her likings and the waiter was super nice and accommodating and made her another meal and let her choose a different one. The manger came straight to us after and asked if she would like a salad in the meantime and was super apologetic. Very surprised to see this customer care! Good job Chili's you surprised me and i will be back for sure and not even think twice of going to a chain without thinking of this first.

My boyfriend and I decided to place an order-to-go online and pick it up. We requested to pick it up at 8:59. When I got there I was ignored by the first waiter but I figured he was busy assisting someone else. While I waited another waiter placed a bag (which I assumed was mine) on the counter. After waiting another five minutes a waitress asked me if I was being helped. She looked in the bag and told me she would go check on my order. Ten minutes go by and I'm still waiting. I had a strong feeling that the bag on the counter was mine, but what could I do??? I walked around to the bar and see the waitress who was "checking on my order" chit chatting with another waitress. Furious I asked another waiter about my order and guess what....it was sitting there the entire time! I get home and the food was cold. What a waste. I will never come to this location again and I will tell my friends the same.

Honestly, this is the most pleasant chain restaurant experience I've ever had. Both the server and the hostess were amazingly friendly and flexible. The food was what you'd expect, but the service was actually, surprisingly excellent.

Wish I could give NO STARS ... WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. waitress "forgot" to place our order after giving us the wrong appetizer. Then the manager comes over after 2 hours of waiting and BEGS us to place our order AGAIN AFTER 2 HOURS?!? Seriously... Stay away!!!

It is what it is. A chain restaurant-- meaning, you're going to get pretty much the same quality of food and level of service in Rutherford, NJ, as you're going to get in Iowa or Houston, TX, or Miami, FL. The location is depressing; a strip mall in the swampy, industrial wasteland of Rt. 17 N, but other than that...well, it's Chili's. Decent enough food, enough of it, and the price isn't bad. If I were to eat this in a "classier," higher-priced restaurant, I'd be pissed, but it isn't. It's Chili's, and presumably you know what you're getting when you come here. In the times I've been here, I've never had a problem with the food quality or the service.

Poor service from staff AND manager the night of 1/3/16. Not only that, my spinach queso was COMPLETELY covered with guacamole. Once I got the guacamole off top there was hardly any dip, cold cheese, and raw spinach.

Slow service and weak drinks. I know its a chain resturant, but it really could be much better. I sat 10 to 15 min on my last visit waiting for the waitress to come over for my drink order. Overall just not the best experiences on the multiple occasions that I have been there.

Stop by for dinner on a weekday because I was too lazy to cook for the family.  Ordered bottomless chips and salsa dip and avocado dip, southwestern egg rolls (very delicious by the way but probably loaded with msg).  Main course was chicken fajitas with grilled peppers and onions, sour cream and tomatoes and cheese.  Added the rice and black beans for $1 extra.  Ordered also the mango chile chicken with rice entree.  Kids meal were mini burger sliders and fruits.  We topped it off with ice cream berry cake pie for dessert. Overall, our meal was decent.  Our adult entree and chips and dip was apart of the 2 meals for $20 deal.  We enrolled in their club (free) and collected points to redeem for free kids meal, which worked out here.   Service was good.  Our waiter was attentive to us and always checking if we needed anything else.  I liked the self service checkout that is available at each table.  You see you own itemized bill through a little screen.  If you choose to pay your bill on credit card, you can swipe and have the option to either print your receipt or have it email to you.  Once paid, the light on the screen top turns from red to green so the waiter knows you've paid.  Awesome!  All restaurant should start doing this so we don't have to flag the waiter for our check!

I'm not a usual patron to Chili's but the free rewards drew me back. This Chili's is a newer location right next to Lowe's with plenty of parking. It is situated in a strip mall near other shops. The service was fine that day as went in for dinner Friday night. We ordered the 20 dollar dinner for 2 deal that includes 2 entrees and appetizer. I ordered the mango chicken with rice while my wife ordered the chicken fajitas. We got the Guacamole with Salsa and chips as our appetizer. When you are finished you can ask for more chips and salsa.  I have read other reviews the service is is poor, but the time we had our server he was okay. I guess it depends when you go or the servers to get. He was knowledgeable on the menu and he checked in to see if we needed anything else. For dessert, we had the triple berry cake and it was delicious. They also have some big screen TV's to watch some games if you go during game times.  When we were finish they have a tablet like machine that you can pay when your done. Its a self checkout device that you scan your credit card and gives a green light when you are cleared so the servers knows that your paid your bill. I thought it was neat because you hear on the news some places, the servers take the credit cards and copies your credit card number. The machine also doubles as a device for the kids to play games with so they are not bored. Overall. the place is okay for a nice meal and I guess depending who you get as a server can make a difference.

The Chili's headquarter's customer relationship and Chili's CEO are obnoxious. I contacted the company several times for missing points of reward. No responses for online inquiries, wrote to the CEO Roberts, got an arrogant woman from customer relationship. Will stay away from Chili's.
I have had terrible service every time I have been to this location. Food is what you expect from a Chilis. Luckily you can pay at the table and they have other locations close by.

Service is awful.  2nd time within a week and servers are slow.  We ordered appetizers and the entrees to save time and the appetizers came 15 mins after entrees.  No matter it is a lot of customers or not service is slow.

Been there a few times and it's very inconsistent. Tonight was the last time I will go. Went with family. It took about 5-10 minutes for someone to greet and seat us. I think our waitress was new, which I understand, but it took over an hour to get our food. I ordered a drink with 3 different people and never got it. Our waitress only came to take the order and never came back. We never even heard from a manager. Food was okay. What you would expect from a chilis. Very poor service though. Very disappointed. Took about 2 1/2 hours from going in to leaving. And we only had one drink each (if someone came back to offer us more we may have had them).

This is absolutely the worse when it comes to customer service. I've visited this restaurant twice now and each experience was relatively the same. Inattentive staff that take forever to acknowledge and serve you mediocre food.

Worst service I have ever had at a chili's. I have been to this location a couple times hoping it would have improved but no. 20+ minutes to get our drinks (waters) and the waiter forgot our appetizer. Food is what you expect from a Chili's. maybe slightly worse because by the time you get your food you don't even care, you just want to eat and get out.
Enjoyed the service very much from appetizer to dinner and drinks. the waitress jordan she was amazing loving young lady....

Service was slow and inattentive.  My son was sick after we left so not sure if we can blame this site. The food seemed old and re-heated.  My sons macaroni and cheese looked like day old Kraft dinner

Went to chills in east Rutherford on 10/16/16 , just got back from vaca wanted a quick bite before heading home , so we walk in , my wife and I , not busy went to the bar sat .......2 minutes later we were asked if we wanted something, 2 beers please , girl turned from us and proceeded to ignore us , talked to some guy made a drink talked more , never even looked at us , needless to say 5 minutes later I got up and left , hate to say it but give me someone that wants to work instead of some pampered airhead
The food was really good. Looking forward to come back. I highly recommend thank you very much.

Out of the many experiences I have had with this location, this one may be the best. The food was spot on, and service was great. The reason: Ruben. He is probably the best waiter in this restaurant. He is attentive, fast, and helped us a lot during our visit. In conclusion, if you want a great experience here at Chilis guaranteed, ASK FOR RUBEN!

This place is terrible. The poor bartender had to clean all the glasses because the shift from the night before washed them in dirty water. The food was disgusting. I got the ribs special that came with smoked sausage. The sausage was in editable and the ribs sucked. My wife got steak nachos and had to pick all the stake off cause it tasted like it went bad. The lady behind us got some kind of fish and I honestly don't know how she ate it, it smelt so bad. Poor lady is probably hunched over a toilet as I write this. I have been to this chillis a few times in the past , it's usually decent as far as chain food goes but, now it is completely crap. Fire management and try again and until they do that I recommend you stay away or risk getting sick.

This restaurant review is based on their operation, which is a 1-star rating.  On a brighter note, our server was a very cheery guy (forgot his name) on a Sunday evening, put on a very nice smile for the crowd despite his working conditions.  He's a good guy working in a crappy environment. First off, we were not aware that we were to be charged $1.99 for our children to play on their game pad.  This was not even disclosed that we were going to be charged!  How dare this restaurant do this.  But, our cheery guy server made it right by removing that charge from our bill.  I'm not the type that would complain over $1.99, but this is about a matter of principles.   Second, the restaurant only had vanilla ice cream remaining tonight (sunday night), which prompted an up-sell to the premium desserts at $7.99 and upwards.  That was a cheesy operations tactic that people should be aware of! Food: It was just okay, but on the salty side as usual in all of these chain box cookie-cutter Americana restaurants.   We've had the grilled fahitas.  Nothing to write home to.  I give it a 3-star rating for food. Overall, this place scores a 2-star rating.

never experienece a such a bad service waiting to be serve another table behind us got ocuppied and the waiter took their order totally got ignored  nobody came to us until we stand up and a guy came but I felt that was wrong is that color descrimination here? Thank God I am not a loud person just walk away and left. I hope this was a big mistake from them. But if you aren't white people becareful to come here. By the way the food is not that good like any other Chillis .

Went to Chili's in East Rutherford on March 25, 2017 and tried the ribs and chicken from their new Smokehouse menu.  The didn't even resemble the pictures on the menu.  Both meats had a greyish white appearance, and just dabbed with some BBQ sauce.  The food was cold!!  It was one of the most unappealing meals I've seen.  I actually felt queasy looking at the food.  It was a very sad attempt BBQ ribs and chicken.   Check out the pictures of the actual meal compared to the menu.  Where's the nice BBQ charring, the rich sauce, spices on the ribs, etc???  Terrible meal that was sent back for something else.  Do yourself a favor, skip the BBQ items.  They can't do it right!

Been there numerous times, no issues, but tonight was completely different. The food came out cold and the desert was given to us by someone who didn't care. We called management over to have them re make the dessert, the second time it came out looking worse. Who seriously messes up on a molten cake?
You're standard Chili's fare however, I appreciate their customer service over the Chili's in Secaucus which is much closer to my home.
A typical Chili's, with wonderful service. Nicole and frank were great!
I've never been to a Chili's before, but I actually really like it. The portions are huge and the drinks are so much fun.

This place serves the food cold. The waitress that attended me was rude, and did not come to check on our table. I asked for a refill of soda, and she never brought it until i asked another waiter. Then she came back to my table to give me an attitude and say I didn't forget your drink I was just busy. Also, they never have any desserts, apparently they always run out of Ice cream, or the chocolate molten cake.

This place is alright, the service is good. However the ribs and some of the food were cold in the beginning after we got our food. The server was very knowledgeable and helpful about all the menu items. Not sure if I will return.

I guess if you have a few drinks you won't know that the food is so-so. The presentation is nice and the service is good, far better than the food deserves. Don't go by the pictures in the menu as what you get served is a lot smaller then the pictures. To me it seemed that everything was portion packed and nuked. Nothing was hot, just lukewarm. Even what was initially a suitable temperature cooled off so very fast that I was sure it was not freshly cooked.

Came here with a large group for lunch to celebrate someone's birthday.  As I expected, there was a long wait for cold food that probably sat in the window waiting for the other food to be prepared so it would all come out at the same time.... stale room temperature fries and soggy fried food is what we got. The server was cool and my complaints are not in the realm of his control so nothing against him. Even with low expectations, Chili's always disappoints, no matter the location. If your gonna come here maybe stick to the ribs and salads, and hope for the best.

Again another review based solely on service. I like chili's.. normally. Tonight at this location, ugh. Just ugh. Our waiter blatantly ignored us multiple times. The service was slow and he was clearly overwhelmed. We had to ask multiple times for things. Very unenjoyable.  Oh... and we got the wrong dessert.

Did not like the food, the service or anything. Place was completely empty and they sat us at a tiny table when there was 6 of us saying they were waiting for a reservation which never showed up. The waitress got our order wrong or the cook did. Table was not prepared. Was so hard to find the waitress just to ask for extra napkins.  When she finally brought the napkins she literally handed us two extra napkins. Ordered a chicken sandwich with avocado and it ha no avocado.  There was literally only two other tables with people. This turned me off completely from visiting any chili's again

Well we went again today and had another less than stellar experience.   Our waiter was new and one of only two on staff to cover the dining room.  Service was slow and orders came out wrong.  When the problem wasn't rectified we asked for the manager and manager Oscar was not at all willing to rectify the situation by removing the portion of the bill for the items wrong or missing.   On top of that the bill was wrong and we were overcharged.   Poor waiter was so apologetic but Oscar's inability to fix the issue and his total lack of dining room management (we sat a long time with dirty dishes as he passed our table multiple times) caused me to update my previous review(below). At least tonight the food was passable.   Come on even Chili's customers deserve at least an adequate dining experience.  Previous visit:   Bad visit today!!  Service terrible. Apps and food came out together. Food horrible. Quesadillas burnt with little to no meat.  Waiter nonexistent.   Sat without beverages way too long. Even dessert was over done.  In an area with scores of dining choices Chili needs to up their game.

I can't believe I actually thought I would get a properly cooked steak at a Chili's. My BAD!!! I send my ribeye back and the second one was just as BAD! I feel terrible for the servers. I realize its not their fault but I can not in my right mind tip my normal 25% after leaving hungry.
